src.title: A Dictionary of american idioms, fifth edition
src.author: Adam Makkai, Ph.D.

src.title: Word Reference : Dictionnaire de langue en ligne
Collins French Dictionary | Translations, Definitions, and Pronunciations

def.alt: to get OR to have cold feet
to get ~ feet about doing sth
to get cold feet about sth

example.phrase: Everyone gets nervous before their wedding; it's just cold feet.

def.trad: avoir les frousses, avoir la pétoche, avoir les jetons
(note : mariage) se demander si c'est une bonne idée, y réfléchir à deux fois

example.phrase: He was starting to get cold feet about the wedding.
Il commençait à hésiter à franchir le pas.
Il commençait à se demander si c'était une bonne idée de se marier.

def.alt: have cold feet, have got cold feet
to keep one's feet on the ground
to have one's feet firmly on the ~
to have one's OR both feet (firmly) on the ground
to have one's feet on the ground
have your feet on the ground
to get a foot in the door
def.trad: poser des jalons, établir le contact

def.alt: to have a foot in the door

example.phrase: well at least it's a foot in the door
au moins, c'est un premier pas OR contact

def.alt: to help sb get their foot in the door; to help sb get their toe in the door
def.trad: mettre à qqn le pied à l'étrier, mettre qqn en selle

def.alt: get your foot in the door
def.trad: mettre le pied [quelque part], avoir un pied [quelque part]
avoir le pied dans la place

example.phrase: I came on foot
je suis venu à pied
It sometimes takes longer to drive than to get to work on foot.
Il va tous les jours à pied à son travail.
on your feet!
debout!
Waitresses are on their feet all day.
Les serveuses sont debout toute la journée.
you've got to put your ~ down
il faut réagir

def.trad: ne pas vouloir en entendre parler

example.phrase: He was going to go skiing, but his wife put her foot down.
Il allait partir au ski, mais sa femme n'a pas voulu en entendre parler.
If you put your foot down, we can get through the lights before they turn red.
Mais si, tu peux passer avant que le feu passe au rouge : appuie sur le champignon !
I had to put my foot down and tell him I wouldn't lie for him again.
J'ai dû taper du poing et lui dire que je n'allais pas mentir à nouveau pour lui.

def.trad: être sur les talons de qn

head.expr: Head over heels also heels over head
head.coca: Head over heels; heels over head

def.alt: to be ~ over heels in love with sb

def.paraphrase: to fall head over heels in love
def.trad: tomber follement amoureux/euse, tomber éperdument amoureux/euse

example.phrase: Alex fell head over heels down the mountainside.
Alex est tombé la tête la première sur le flanc de la montagne.

def.trad: Tomber raide dingue (amoureux), tomber raide dingue (amoureuse)
Tomber fou amoureux, tomber folle amoureuse

example.phrase: After knowing him for just two weeks I'd fallen head over heels.
Apres l'avoir fréquenté pendant deux semaines, je suis tombée raide dingue amoureuse de lui.

def.trad: tomber raide dingue (amoureux) de [qqn], tomber raide dingue (amoureuse) de [qqn]
tomber fou amoureux de [qqn], tomber folle amoureuse de [qqn]

def.alt: fall head over heels in love with [sb]
def.trad: tomber raide dingue (amoureux) de [qqn], tomber raide dingue (amoureuse) de [qqn]
tomber fou amoureux de [qqn], tomber folle amoureuse de [qqn]

example.phrase: After Cara's first date with Matt, she was head over heels in love with him.
Après son premier rendez-vous avec Matt, Cara est tombée follement amoureuse de lui.

def.trad: réaction instinctive, réaction spontanée, réaction irréfléchie

example.phrase: I admit my response was a knee-jerk reaction; when I thought about it later I wish I'd never said it.
J'admets que j'ai eu une réaction irréfléchie. Quand j'y ai repensé plus tard, j'aurais aimé ne rien avoir dit.

def.alt: to go down on one's ~s to sb

example.phrase: He was on his knees.
Il était à genoux.
Many religions require you to be on your knees to pray.

def.alt: fall on your knees, fall to your knees

example.phrase: Before we went to bed we got onto our knees and prayed.
Avant d'aller nous coucher, nous nous sommes agenouillés pour prier.
After 20 years of war the country is on its knees.
Après 20 ans de guerre, le pays est à genoux.
Après des années de guerre, le pays est à genoux.
Le dictateur a mis la population sur les rotules.
If you want to borrow his preious car, you'll have to get down on your knees!

head.expr: A pain in the ass or a pain in the butt or a pain in the rear

example.phrase: he's a real ~
il est vraiment casse-pieds

def.alt: to be a pain in the arse (Britain), to be a pain in the ass (US)

example.phrase: he's a pain in the arse (UK, very informal) OR backside OR ass (US, very informal)
il est chiant (very informal), c'est un emmerdeur (very informal)

def.alt: pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)
def.paraphrase: source of annoyance ; personne : argot, vulgaire

def.alt: pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)

example.phrase: My boss is always looking over my shoulder and is starting to become a real pain in the ass.
Ça devient vraiment chiant (or: casse-couilles) d'avoir le chef tout le temps derrière mon dos !

def.alt: pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)
def.paraphrase: source of annoyance ; chose, personne : vulgaire

def.alt: pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)
def.paraphrase: source of annoyance ; chose, personne : familier

example.phrase: Ça devient vraiment gonflant d'avoir le chef tout le temps derrière mon dos !

def.alt: pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)
pain in the ass (US), pain in the arse (UK)
def.paraphrase: source of annoyance ; personne, chose : familier

example.phrase: Ça devient vraiment casse-pieds d'avoir le chef tout le temps deriière mon dos !

head.expr: Bust one's ass or bust one's balls or bust one's chop

example.phrase: I've been busting my ass for weeks now trying to get this project finished!
Je me casse le cul depuis depuis des semaines pour essayer de finir ce projet !

head.expr: Flat on one's ass or flat on one's back

example.phrase: he was lying flat on his back
il était allongé à plat sur le dos

def.alt: to be flat on one's back
to be flat on one's back
def.trad: être alité OU cloué au lit
allongé sur le dos, couché sur le dos, étendu sur le dos

example.phrase: After that 10 mile hike, he was so tired he was flat on his back for an hour.
Après cette marche de 16km, il était tellement fatigué qu'il est resté allongé sur le dos pendant une heure.
You don't like it? Well kiss my ass!
T'aimes pas ? Bah va te faire voir !
T'aimes pas ? Bah va te faire foutre !

def.trad: dire ce que l'on a sur le cœur
dire ce qu'on a sur le cœur

def.alt: to get sth off one's chest
to get something off one's chest
def.trad: dire ce qu'on a sur le coeur

head.expr: Back to the wall or back against the wall

def.alt: to have one's ~ to the wall

example.phrase: he had his back to the ~
il était le dos au mur

def.alt: have your back to the wall
to have one's back to the wall
def.paraphrase: to have one's back against the wall
def.trad: être au pied du mur, être le dos au mur

def.alt: to have one's back to the wall
to have one's back to the wall

example.phrase: the decision was taken behind my back
la décision a été prise derrière mon dos

def.alt: to do sth behind sb's back
def.trad: faire qch derrière le dos de qn

example.phrase: She often told lies about him behind his back.
Elle parle souvent de son mari dans son dos.
Don't go behind her back; if you think she's wrong, tell her directly.
N'agis pas dans son dos. Si tu pense qu'elle a tort, dis-le-lui directement.
get off my ~, will you?
fiche-moi la paix !
get off my back!
fiche-moi la paix !

def.trad: lâcher les baskets de [qqn], lâcher la grappe de [qqn]
être sur le dos de qn

example.phrase: my boss is always on my ~
j'ai sans arrêt mon patron sur le dos
he's always on my back
il me critique OU harcèle toujours
His year-end bonus was a pat on the back for his hard word that year.
Sa prime de fin d'année fut une tape dans le dos pour tout son travail cette année.
You can all pat yourselves on the back. Well done, team!
Congratulations on a job well done. Pat yourself on the back.
Vous avez bien travaillé. Félicitations !

def.alt: to give sb a ~ on the back

example.phrase: you deserve a ~ on the back!
félicitations !

def.alt: to pat sb on the back
to pat somebody on the back
def.trad: tapoter quelqu'un OR donner une petite tape à quelqu'un dans le dos

def.alt: to pat somebody on the back

sub-entry.alt: to turn one's back on sb/sth

example.phrase: you can't just turn your ~ on your parents
tu ne peux quand même pas tourner le dos à tes parents
he turned his ~ on the past
il a tourné la page

def.alt: to turn one's back on somebody (literal)

example.phrase: how can you turn your back on your own family?
comment peux-tu abandonner ta famille ?
Shame on you for turning your back on your friends after such a small disagreement.
Honte à toi pour avoir tourné ton dos à tes amis après un désaccord aussi insignifiant.
I thumbed through the pile of bills, just to see if any were past due.
She thumbed through a magazine while waiting to be attended to.
J'ai feuilleté la pile de facture pour voir si certaines étaient en retard.
Elle a feuilleté une magazine en attendant que l'on s'occupe d'elle.
all the basic controls are at your ~s
toutes les commandes principales sont à portée de main

def.alt: to have sth at one's fingertips

sub-grp.trad: savoir qch sur le bout des doigts

def.alt: to have information at one's fingertips
def.trad: connaître des informations sur le bout de doigt

def.alt: to have information at one's fingertips
def.trad: avoir des informations à portée de main

example.phrase: You should have everything you need at your fingertips before you start your work.
Il faut avoir tout à portée de main avant de commencer à travailler.
~s crossed!
croisons les doigts !
keep your ~s crossed for me!
souhaite-moi bonne chance !
cross your fingers OR keep your fingers crossed for me
pense à moi et croise les doigts

def.alt: to keep one's fingers crossed, to cross one's fingers

head.expr: lift a finger or lift a hand also raise a hand

example.phrase: he wouldn't lift a ~ to help me
il ne lèverait pas le petit doigt pour m'aider
you never lift OR raise a finger to help
tu ne lèves jamais le petit doigt pour aider

def.alt: lift a finger, lift a hand

example.phrase: Jodie would appreciate some help in the kitchen, but Josh never lifts a finger.
He never lifts a finger.
Il ne lève jamais le petit doigt.
No one lifted a finger to help them.
Personne n'a levé le petit doigt pour les aider.

head.expr: Put one's finger on also lay one's finger on
head.coca: PUT _ap finger on; LAY _ap finger on

example.phrase: there's something wrong, but I can't put my ~ on it
il y a quelque chose qui cloche* mais je ne peux pas mettre le doigt dessus

def.alt: to put one's finger one something
def.trad: mettre le doigt sur quelque chose

def.alt: to put one's finger on sth
put your finger on [sth], lay your finger on [sth]

example.phrase: I've just put my finger on why I find it so hard getting up in the morning: I hate my job!
J'ai enfin mis le doigt sur ce qui me fait traîner les pieds le matin : je déteste mon boulot !
If you put your finger on the dog's nose it may bite you.
Si tu mets ton doigt sur le nez du chien, il pourrait te mordre.

head.expr: At hand also at close at hand or near at hand

example.phrase: having the equipment at ~ will be very helpful
ce sera très pratique d'avoir l'équipment à portée de main

def.alt: to be near at hand, to be close at hand
def.trad: être à portée de main, être à portée de la main

example.phrase: With Christmas at hand, we are very busy in the shop.

def.trad: à portée de main, sous la main

example.phrase: I keep a torch at hand because of the frequent electricity cuts.
Je garde toujours une lampe sous la main à cause des fréquentes coupures de courant.
Je garde toujours une lampe pas loin à cause des fréquentes coupures de courant.

def.alt: close at hand, close to hand

example.phrase: In flu season, keep a box of tissues close at hand.
"Nuclear war is close at hand!" was emblazoned on the black and yellow leaflets.
I had no ~ in it
je n'y suis pour rien
Wilson scored one goal and had a hand in two others.
Wilson a marqué un but et a été impliqué dans deux autres.
Gwyneth had a hand in persuading Celia to change her mind.
Gwyneth a été impliquée dans le changement d'avis de Celia.

def.alt: take a hand in [sth], take a hand in doing [sth], have a hand in [sth], have a hand in doing [sth]

def.trad: ne pas avoir une minute à soi

def.alt: to have one's hands full with sth
def.trad: avoir beaucoup à faire avec qch

example.phrase: Jason was at the door, suitcase in ~
Jason était à la porte, sa valise à la main
he opened the door, gun in ~
il a ouvert la porte, pistolet au poing
he had the situation well in ~
il avait la situation bien en main
to take sb in ~
prendre qn en main
he had £6,000 in ~
il avait 6 000 livres de disponibles
let's concentrate on the job in ~
revenons à nos moutons
Hughes finished with 15 seconds in hand
Hughes finit avec 15 secondes d'avance
We have the situation in hand.
Nous avons la situation bien en main.

def.trad: se donner la main, se prendre la main

example.phrase: The entire congregation joined hands in prayer.
Toute l'assemblée a joint ses mains pour prier.
Toutes les fidèles se dont données la main (or: se sont pris la main) pour prier.
Let's join hands and fight for what we believe in!
Donnons-nous la mains et luttons ensemble pour cette noble cause !
We will join hands with our friends and fight for our common beliefs.

head.expr: Lend a hand or give a hand also bear a hand

def.alt: to give sb a hand, to lend sb a hand
def.trad: donner un coup de main à qn

example.phrase: Can you give me a hand?
Tu peux me donner unc coup de main ?

def.alt: to give sb a hand to do sth
def.trad: donner un coup de main à qn pour faire qch
donner un coup de main à quelqu'un

example.phrase: If you could lend a hand when I move at the end of the month, I would appreciate it.
Si tu pouvais me donner un coup de main pour mon déménagement à la fin du mois, j'en serais reconnaissant.
Si tu pouvais me prêter la main pour mon déménagement à la fin du mois, j'en serais reconnaissant.
the children are now off our ~s
maintenant nous n'avons plus les enfants à la maison
I'll take if off your ~s
je vous débarrasse ?

def.alt: to get sth of one's hands

def.trad: ne plus être la responsabilité de qn

example.phrase: I have more free time now the children are off my hands
J'ai davantage de temps libre sans les enfants sur les bras
there are experts on ~ to give you advice
il y a des experts sur place pour vous conseiller

def.trad: (changement de sujet) avoir [qch] sous la main

def.alt: on the one ~ ..., on the other ~

example.phrase: yes, but on the other ~ he is very rich
oui, mais il est très riche

def.alt: on the one hand ... , on the other hand

example.phrase: One one hand, the restaurant serves excellent food, but on the other, it's very expensive.
D'un côté, le restaurant sert des plats excellents ; de l'autre, il est vraiment cher.

def.alt: on the one hand ... on the other hand, on the one hand ... on the other, on one hand ... on the other hand, on one hand ... on the other

example.phrase: On the one hand, it would be quicker to fly to Manchester; on the other, it would be more expensive than the train.
D'un côté, il serait plus rapide d'aller à Manchester en avion, mais de l'autre, ce serait plus cher que de prendre le train.
we've got a difficult job on our ~s
une tâche difficile nous attend
he had time on his ~s
il avait du temps devant lui

def.alt: to have sth on one's hands
to have a big task on one's hands
def.trad: avoir du pain sur la planche

example.phrase: We have a fight on our hands.
Un véritable combat nous attend.
When the fight got out of hand, the barman called the police.
La situation est vite devenue incontrôlable.
The party got out of hand, and a neighbour called the police.
La fête a dégéneré et un voisin a appelé la police.
Julia's my right-hand man when it comes to planning parties.
she threw up her hands in horror
elle a levé les bras en signe d'horreur

def.alt: to rub shoulders with sb, to rub elbows with sb (US)
rub shoulders with [sb], rub elbows with [sb]

example.phrase: She likes to rub shoulders with important people.

def.alt: to welcome sb with open arms
to welcome somebody/something with open arms
def.trad: accueillir quelqu'un/quelque chose à bras ouverts

example.phrase: James greeted me with open arms.
James m'a accueilli à bras ouverts.

def.alt: to have a ~ on one's shoulder
to have a chip on one's shoulder (informal)
def.trad: en vouloir à tout le monde

def.alt: to have a chip on one's shoulder
def.trad: en vouloir à tout le monde

def.alt: have a chip on your shoulder
def.trad: être aigri, en vouloir à tout le monde

example.phrase: he stands ~ and shoulders above everybody else
il dépasse tout le monde d'une tête
he stands ~ and shoulders above everybody else
il surpasse tout le monde
she's head and shoulders above the rest
les autres ne lui arrivent pas à la cheville

def.alt: to stand head and shoulders above sb

sub-grp.trad: dépasser qn de la tête et des épaules

example.phrase: She stands head and shoulders above him.
Il ne lui arrive pas à la cheville.

def.alt: be head and shoulders above [sb/sth], stand head and shoulders above [sb/sth]

example.phrase: George's essay was head and shoulders above those of the rest of the class.
La dissertation de George était largement au-dessus de celles de ses camarades de classe.
I looked over my shoulder
j'ai jeté un coup d'oeil derrière moi

sub-grp.trad: regarder derrière soi (en tournant la tête)

example.phrase: all the responsabilities had fallen on his ~s
toutes les responsabilités reposaient sur ses épaules
Let's stand shoulder to shoulder and get the job done!
Serrons-nous les coudes et terminons ce travail !
The hotel workers' union stood shoulder to shoulder with the restaurant workers' union in the strike.

def.trad: se casser OU se rompre le cou

example.phrase: I'll break his neck if I catch him doing it again!
je lui tords le cou si je le reprends à faire ça !

def.trad: se rompre le cou, se casser le cou

example.phrase: Chris ended up paralyzed after breaking his neck in a motorcycle accident.

def.trad: se casser le cul, se crever le cul

example.phrase: This project is so much work; I've been breaking my neck and I still don't feel like I'm going anywhere!
hold your tongue!
tenez votre langue !
taisez-vous !

def.alt: hold your tongue, bite your tongue

example.phrase: You must hold your tongue and not tell your mother-in-law what you really think of her cooking.
Tu dois tenir ta langue et ne pas dire à ta belle-mère ce que tu penses vraiment de ses talents de cuisinière.

head.expr: Fly in the face of or fly in the teeth of

def.alt: to fly in the face of sth
to fly in the face of something

head.expr: Get one's teeth into or sink one's teeth into
head.coca: GET _ap teeth into ; SINK _ap teeth into

def.trad: se mettre à qch pour de bon

example.phrase: I sank my teeth into the peach
j'ai mordu dans la pêche

def.alt: to get one's teeth into something
def.trad: se mettre à fond à quelque chose

def.alt: to sink one's teeth into sth
def.trad: mordre à belles dents dans qch

example.phrase: The dog sank its teeth into her leg.
Le chien a mordit à la jambe.
The vampire sank his teeth into her soft neck.
I like an acting role I can really sink my teeth into.
J'aimerais un rôle auquel je pourrrais m'attaquer.

def.alt: to fight sth tooth and nail
def.trad: se battre bec et ongles contre qch

example.phrase: Sally fought tooth and nail to get the promotion.
Sally s'est battue bec et ongles pour obtenir cette promotion.

head.expr: Read my lips or mark my words
head.coca: READ my lips; MARK my words

example.phrase: ~ my lips!
vou m'avez bien compris ?

head.expr: Jaw drop or jaw drop a mile
head.coca: Jaw DROP; jaw DROP a mile

example.phrase: his ~ dropped
il en est resté bouche bée
his jaw dropped in astonishment
il en est resté bouche bée
he kept his ~ shut (about it)
il n'en a pas soufflé mot
keep your mouth shut
n'en parlez à personne
gardez-le pour vous
keep your mouth shut! (don't tell anyone)
ne dis rien !

def.alt: by OR through word of mouth

example.phrase: He hoped that word of mouth would attract customers to his landscape business.
Il espérerait que le bouche à oreille attirerait des clients dans son entreprise de paysagisme.
Word-of-mouth advertising is not always reliable.
La publicité par le bouche à oreille n'est pas toujours fiable.
you've got OR hit it right on the nose
tu as mis en plein dans le mille

def.alt: on the nose, right on the nose

example.phrase: Your guess was right on the nose.
C'est exactement ça !
Tu as tapé dans le mille avec ton estimation.

head.expr: Under one's nose or under the nose of
head.coca: Under _ap nose; under the nose of

example.phrase: it was right under his ~ all the time
c'était là juste sous son nez
she did it right under his ~
elle l'a fait sous son nez
it was (right) under my nose all the time
c'était en plein sous mon nez

def.alt: to be happening under sb's nose
def.trad: se passer sous le nez de qn

def.alt: from under [sb]'s nose, right from under [sb]'s nose, from under [sb]'s very nose

example.phrase: She was being extremely rude but I decided to turn the other cheek.
Elle était extrêmement malpolie mais j'ai décidé de tendre l'autre joue.
A picture on the wall caught his eye.
Une photo sur le mur a attiré son attention.
He tried to catch her eye.
Il essaya d'attirer son regard.

def.alt: to catch somebody's attention OR somebody's eye
to try to catch somebody's eye
def.trad: essayer d'attirer le regard de quelqu'un

head.expr: Close one's eyes or shut one's eyes
head.coca: CLOSE _ap eyes to; SHUT _ap eyes to

def.alt: to close one's ~s to a problem
to close one's ~s to the dangers of sth
def.trad: refuser de voir les écueils de qch

example.phrase: one can't close one's ~s to the fact that ...
il faut bien reconnaître que ...
we can't close OR shut our eyes to the problem
on ne peut pas fermer les yeux sur ce problème

def.alt: to close one's eyes to sth, to shut one's eyes to sth

def.trad: faire semblant de ne pas voir

example.phrase: Most families close their eyes to the fact that they're responsible for their children's failures.

def.alt: shut your eyes, shut your eyes to [sth], close your eyes to [sth]

example.phrase: She shut her eyes to her husbands activities.
Elle a fermé les yeux sur les activités de son mari.

def.trad: personne ou chose qui est là pour le plaisir des yeux
(chose, personne) [qqn/qch] qui est agréable à regarder

example.phrase: There was some very nice eye candy at the party last night.
Il y avait des beaux mecs à la fête hier soir.

head.expr: Have an eye on or have one's eye on
head.coca: HAVE an eye on; HAVE _ap eye on

sub-entry.alt: to have one's eye on sth

example.phrase: he's got his ~ on the championship
il a en vue le championnat
I've already got my ~ on a house
j'ai déjà une maison en vue
the boss has his eye on Smith for the job
le parton a Smith en vue pour le poste
she has her eye on the mayor's position
elle vise la mairie

def.alt: to have one's eye on sb
to have one's eye on sth

example.phrase: I've got my eye on a little yellow handbag I saw in a shop windo.
Je lorgne sur un petit sac jaune que j'ai vu dans une vitrine.
I've got my eye on you, young man. So behave!
Je te surveille, jeune homme. Alors, pas de bêtises !
Je vous ai à l'œil, jeune homme. Alors, pas de bêtises !
The company has an eye on future expansion into overseas markets.
I keep working this job, but I have my eye on going back to college.
Je fais ce petit boulot mais je compte reprendre mes études.

head.expr: Keep an eye on or keep one's eye on or have one's eye on
head.coca: KEEP an eye on; KEEP _ap eye on; HAVE an eye on; HAVE _ap eye on

example.phrase: will you keep an ~ on the baby?
vous pouvez surveiller le bébé ?

def.alt: to keep an eye on sth

example.phrase: keep your eye on the ball
fixez OU regardez bien la balle

def.alt: keep an eye on the situation

example.phrase: could you keep your eye on the children/the house?
pourriez-vous surveiller les enfants/la maison ?
When cooking soufflés, you need to keep an eye on them so they don't fall.
Quand on fait des soufflés, il faut garder un œil dessus pour ne pas qu'ils ne retombent.

head.expr: Lay eyes on or set eyes on
head.coca: LAY eyes on; SET eyes on

example.phrase: I've never set ~s on him
je ne l'ai jamais vu

def.alt: to set eyes on sth/sb, to clap eyes on sb/sth, to lay eyes on sth/sb

example.phrase: I've never clapped (informal) OR set OR laid eyes on her
je ne l'ai jamais vue de ma vie

head.expr: Out of the corner of one's eye
head.coca: Out of the corner of _ap eye

def.alt: to look at sb out of the ~ of one's eye
def.trad: regarder qn du coin de l'œil

def.alt: to look at somebody/something out of the corner of one's eye
def.trad: regarder quelqu'un/quelque chose du coin de l'œil

def.alt: out of the corner of your eye

example.phrase: She couldn't describe him accurately because she'd only seen him out of the corner of her eye.
Elle ne pouvait pas bien décrire l'homme parce qu'elle ne l'avait vu que du coin de l'œil.

def.alt: to see eye to eye with sb on sth
def.trad: être d'accord avec qn au sujet de qch

example.phrase: she and I don't see eye to eye
[disagree] elle ne voit pas les choses du même oeil que moi, elle n'est pas de mon avis
[dislike one another] elle et moi, nous ne nous entendons pas
We don't always see eye to eye.
Nous ne sommes pas toujours d'accord.

def.alt: to turn a blind eye to sth, to turn a blind eye on sth
to turn a blind eye to something
def.trad: fermer les yeux sur quelque chose

example.phrase: I knew exactly what she was up to but decided to turn a blind eye.
Je savais exactement ce qu'elle mijotait mais 'ai décidé de fermer les yeux.

def.alt: turn a blind eye on [sth], turn a blind eye to [sth]

example.phrase: The corrupt inspector decided to turn a blind eye to the safety violations.
they ~d their eyebrows when they heard
ils ont tiqué quand ils ont entendu
he didn't ~ an eyebrow
il n'a pas sourcillé
her behaviour raised a few eyebrows (figurative)
son comportement en a fait tiquer quelques-uns

def.alt: raise eyebrows, raise a few eyebrows
raise eyebrows, raise a few eyebrows

example.phrase: her behavior raised a few eyebrows
son comportement en a fait tiquer quelques-uns
His behaviour raised a few eyebrows.
Son comportement a fait tiquer.

def.alt: to make OR pull a face at somebody
to pull a face, to make a face
pull a face, make a face

example.phrase: The little girl pulled a face when her mother told her they were having fish for dinner.

def.trad: rouge de confusion OR de honte

example.phrase: he won't show his ~ here again
il ne remettra plus les pieds ici
I ought to ~ my face at Paul's party
il faudrait que je fasse acte de présence à la soirée de Paul
he daren't ~ his face here again
il n'ose plus montrer son nez là-bas
he won't show his face here again!
il ne risque pas de remettre les pieds ici !

head.expr: Keep one's cool or keep one's head

example.phrase: keep your head!
gardez votre calme !, ne perdez pas la tête !
Don't lose your head in an emergency. Just stay calm.
Ne perdez pas votre sang-froid en cas d'urgence. Restez calme.
Ne vous affolez pas en cas d'urgence. Restez calme.

head.expr: Off the top of one's head

example.phrase: I'm saying that off the ~ of my head
je dis ça sans savoir exactement
off the top of my head, I'd say it would cost about £1,500
à vue de nez je dirais que ça coute dans les 1 500 livres
I don't know off the top of my head
Je ne sais pas, il faudrait que je vérifie

def.alt: off the top of my head

example.phrase: Off the top of my head, here are a few examples.
De tête, voici quelques exemples.

def.alt: off the top of your head

example.phrase: Off the top of my head, I can't remember the name of that actor.
Comme ça, sans réfléchir, je ne me souviens pas du nom de cet acteur.
his ideas went right over my ~
ses idées me dépassaient complètement
her lecture was completely over my head
sa conférence m'a complètement dépassé
she went over my head to the president
elle est allée voir le président sans me consulter
they were promoted over my head
ils ont été promus avant moi
Martin's explanation was too complicated; it went over my head.
L'explication de Martin était trop compliquée : elle m'a dépassé (or: elle a dépassé ma compréhension)
L'explication de Martin était trop compliquée : elle m'est passée au-dessus de la tête.
turn your head this way
tournez la tête de ce côté
she was so pretty that she turned heads wherever she went
elle était si jolie que tout le monde se retournait sur son passage
success had not turned his head
la réussite ne lui avait pas tourné la tête, il ne s'était pas laissé griser par la réussite.

head.expr: Use one's head or use one's bean or use one's noodle or use one's noggin

example.phrase: use your head!
fais travailler les méninges !
he really gets under my skin
il me tape sur les nerfs, celui-là
I'm an optimist at ~
au fond je suis optimiste
she's still a child at ~
elle est restée très enfant
we have your best interests at ~
vos intérêts nous tiennent à cœur
at heart she was a good person
elle avait un bon fond
my sister's a gypsy at heart
ma sœur est une bohémienne dans l'âme
they have your welfare at heart
ils ne pense qu'à ton bien, c'est pour ton bien qu'ils font cela
Tyler makes a lot of mistakes, but he is a good person at heart.
Marilyn's always been an animal lover at heart.
Tyler fait beaucoup d'erreurs, mais c'est une bonne personne au fond.
Marilyn a toujours été une grande amie ees animaux dans l'âme.
I have your best interests at heart.
J'ai vos meilleurs intérêts à cœur.
he remembered her birthday, bless his heart!
et il n'a pas oublié son anniversaire, le petit chéri !

def.alt: to have a change of heart
to have a change of heart

def.paraphrase: reversal of an attitude or feeling

example.phrase: I don't know what has brought about his change of heart, but Reza now says he'd love to come to France with me.
Je ne sais pas ce qui l'a fait changer d'avis mais Reza dit maintenant qu'il aimerait venir avec moi en France.
She's had a change of heart and is inviting her sister after all.
Elle a changé d'avis et a invité sa sœur finalement.

head.expr: From the bottom of one's heart or with all one's heart
head.coca: From the bottom of _ap heart; With all _ap heart

example.phrase: he thanked them from the bottom of his heart
il les a remerciés du fond du cœur

def.alt: from the bottom of one's heart

example.phrase: have a ~!
pitié !
have a heart!
pitié !
Have a heart and consider donating to this worthwhile charity.
Ayez du cœur et songez à faire un don pour cette association utile.

def.trad: aie un peu de compassion, sois compatissant

example.phrase: Have a heart! Timmy's an only child and didn't mean any harm.
Ayez un peu de compassion ! Timmy est fils unique et il ne voulais pas faire de mal.
My heart went out to them
J'étais de tout cœur avec eux
he has a heart of gold/of stone
il a un cœur d'or/de pierre

def.alt: to have a heart of gold

def.trad: avoir le cœur sur la main

example.phrase: He may seem surly at first, but he really has a heart of gold.
Il peut sembler un peu bourru au début, mais il a vraiment le le cœur sur la main.

head.expr: At the top of one's voice or at the top of one's lungs

def.alt: to shout at the top of one's voice
at the top of one's voice
at the top of your lungs
def.trad: to scream at the top of your lungs : hurler

def.alt: to do something in cold blood

example.phrase: The gunman killed his victim in cold blood.
L'homme de main a tué sa victime de sang-froid.

def.trad: réduire les coûts au strict minimum

def.alt: to work one's fingers to the ~
chilled OR frozen to the bone

example.phrase: his comments were a bit close to OR near the bone
ses commentaire frôlaient l'indécence

def.alt: to be chilled to the bone
def.trad: être glacé jusqu'à la moelle (des os)

def.alt: to be chilled to the bone

def.trad: mettre le doigt là où ça fait mal

def.alt: chilled to the marrow, chilled to the bone, frozen to the marrow
def.trad: glacé jusqu'à la moelle, transi jusqu'à la moelle

example.phrase: I've been out here in the snow for three hours and I'm chilled to the marrow.
Je suis dehors dans la neige depuis trois heures et je suis glacé jusqu'aux os.

def.trad: brûler à la cervelle de qn
se faire sauter OU se brûler la cervelle
faire sauter la cervelle de qn
